comment: In a multigraph, an edge is an unordered pair of vertices. This theorem would not hold for arbitrary hyper-/pseudographs since either ` M ` or ` N ` could be proper classes ( ` ( E `` X ) ` would be a loop in this case), which are no vertices of course. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Aug-2017.) (Revised by AV, 11-Dec-2020.)
